message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with sampling and reconstruction of signals on graphs, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several sub-fields in computer science. The use of coherence and bandlimited signals suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT) and signal processing (cs.SI). The focus on structured sampling and fast reconstruction methods suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and numerical analysis (cs.NA). Finally, the application of these methods to interactive object segmentation in images using superpixels suggests a connection to computer graphics (cs.CG).
